Package com.anylogic.libraries.processmodeling

Interface IResourceUnit

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ResourceUnitExtension

    public interface IResourceUnit

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addTask​(ResourceUnitTask task)
      Adds task to the individual queue of this resource unit.
      ResourceUnitTask currentTask​()
      Returns current task of this unit, null if idle.
      ResourceTaskType currentTaskType​()
      Returns the type of current task, or null if unit is idle
      com.anylogic.engine.markup.INode getHomeLocation​()
      Retunrs the home location for a resource unit.
      double getHomeRotation​()
      Returns the rotation of a resource unit home position.
      double getHomeX​()
      Returns the x coordinate of a resource unit home position.
      double getHomeY​()
      Returns the y coordinate of a resource unit home position.
      double getHomeZ​()
      Returns the z coordinate of a resource unit home position.
      com.anylogic.engine.Agent getReservedBy​()
      Returns agent (entity) which reserved this unit or null.
      ResourceType getResourceType​()
      Returns the type of resource (RESOURCE_STATIC, RESOURCE_MOVING, RESOURCE_PORTABLE)
      com.anylogic.engine.Agent getServicedEntity​()
      Returns the entity which currently possesses this resource unit.
      double getUtilization​()
      Returns the unit utilization: the fraction of time the unit was busy.
      boolean isAttached​()
      Tests if a resource unit is attached to the entity.
      boolean isBusy​()
      Tests if the resource unit is currently busy: seized, moving to usage location or home location.
      boolean isIdle​()
      Tests if the resource unit is currently idle and free to be used
      boolean isReserved​()
      Returns true if this unit is reserved by some request (note that it may be idle - this means that request isn't completed - OR it may be busy with other task, which will be interrupted and preempted when request is completed)
      void removeTask​(ResourceUnitTask task)
      Removes task from this resource unit.
      void resetStats​()
      Resets the unit utilization statistics.
      ResourcePool resourcePool​()
      Returns the ResourcePool object where this unit belongs to.
      void setAttached​(boolean attached)
      Attaches or detaches a resource unit to an entity that possesses it.
      void setHomeLocation​(com.anylogic.engine.markup.INode home)
      Sets the home location for a resource unit.
      void setHomePosition​(double x, double y)
      Sets the coordinates of a resource unit home position.
      void setHomePosition​(double x, double y, double z)
      Sets the coordinates of a resource unit home position.
      double timeInState​(ResourceUsageState state)
      Returns the time the unit has spent in the given "usage state" so far
      double timeInState​(ResourceUsageState state, com.anylogic.engine.TimeUnits units)
      Returns the time the unit has spent in the given "usage state" so far

    • Method Detail

      • resourcePool

        ResourcePool resourcePool​()
        Returns the ResourcePool object where this unit belongs to.

      • getResourceType

        ResourceType getResourceType​()
        Returns the type of resource (RESOURCE_STATIC, RESOURCE_MOVING, RESOURCE_PORTABLE)
        Returns:
        the type of resource (RESOURCE_STATIC, RESOURCE_MOVING, RESOURCE_PORTABLE)

      • isBusy

        boolean isBusy​()
        Tests if the resource unit is currently busy: seized, moving to usage location or home location.
        Returns:
        true if the unit is busy, otherwise false

      • isIdle

        boolean isIdle​()
        Tests if the resource unit is currently idle and free to be used
        Returns:
        true if the unit is idle, otherwise false

      • getUtilization

        double getUtilization​()
        Returns the unit utilization: the fraction of time the unit was busy.
        Returns:
        the unit utilization [0..1]

      • timeInState

        double timeInState​(ResourceUsageState state)
        Returns the time the unit has spent in the given "usage state" so far
        Parameters:
        state - the state (ResourceUsageState.USAGE_IDLE, ResourceUsageState.USAGE_BUSY)
        Returns:
        the time in this state

      • timeInState

        double timeInState​(ResourceUsageState state,
                   com.anylogic.engine.TimeUnits units)
        Returns the time the unit has spent in the given "usage state" so far
        Parameters:
        state - the state (ResourceUsageState.USAGE_IDLE, ResourceUsageState.USAGE_BUSY)
        units - time units
        Returns:
        the time in this state

      • resetStats

        void resetStats​()
        Resets the unit utilization statistics.

      • isReserved

        boolean isReserved​()
        Returns true if this unit is reserved by some request (note that it may be idle - this means that request isn't completed - OR it may be busy with other task, which will be interrupted and preempted when request is completed)
        Returns:
        true if this unit is reserved by some request

      • getReservedBy

        com.anylogic.engine.Agent getReservedBy​()
        Returns agent (entity) which reserved this unit or null.
        Returns:
        the agent which reserved this unit or null.
        See Also:
        isReserved()

      • getServicedEntity

        com.anylogic.engine.Agent getServicedEntity​()
        Returns the entity which currently possesses this resource unit. Returns null if this unit is either idle or is busy with some not entity-related task (e.g. resource maintenance)
        Returns:
        the entity which possesses this resource unit

      • currentTaskType

        ResourceTaskType currentTaskType​()
        Returns the type of current task, or null if unit is idle
        Returns:
        the type of current task

      • currentTask

        @AnyLogicInternalAPI
ResourceUnitTask currentTask​()
        Returns current task of this unit, null if idle. Please note that there is a special task when unit's shift ends
        Returns:
        current task of this unit

      • addTask

        @AnyLogicInternalAPI
void addTask​(ResourceUnitTask task)
        Adds task to the individual queue of this resource unit. Task may start execution if the queue is empty or contains other tasks which may be preempted.
        This function is advanced and shouldn't be normally called.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to assign to the resource unit

      • removeTask

        @AnyLogicInternalAPI
void removeTask​(ResourceUnitTask task)
        Removes task from this resource unit. If the task is currently being executed, it will be finished and unit will proceed to the next available tasks (if any)
        This function is advanced and shouldn't be normally called.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to remove

      • setHomeLocation

        void setHomeLocation​(com.anylogic.engine.markup.INode home)
        Sets the home location for a resource unit.
        Parameters:
        home - the home node

      • getHomeLocation

        com.anylogic.engine.markup.INode getHomeLocation​()
        Retunrs the home location for a resource unit.
        Returns:
        the home location for a resource unit

      • setHomePosition

        void setHomePosition​(double x,
                     double y)
        Sets the coordinates of a resource unit home position.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate

      • setHomePosition

        void setHomePosition​(double x,
                     double y,
                     double z)
        Sets the coordinates of a resource unit home position.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate
        z - the z coordinate

      • getHomeRotation

        double getHomeRotation​()
        Returns the rotation of a resource unit home position.
        Returns:
        the rotation of a resource unit home position

      • setAttached

        @AnyLogicInternalAPI
void setAttached​(boolean attached)
        Attaches or detaches a resource unit to an entity that possesses it. May be called only for units which are seized by entities, otherwise an error will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        attached - true to attach, false to detach

      • isAttached

        @AnyLogicInternalAPI
boolean isAttached​()
        Tests if a resource unit is attached to the entity.
        Returns:
        true if the unit is attached, otherwise false
